flammable_gases.rationale: Flammable range with air is 4.9-20.7 vol%.

gases_under_pressure.hazard_statement: Contains gas under pressure; may explode if heated

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gas substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on rat LD50: 100 to 200 mg/kg (ACGIH (2001) and DFGOT (1996)) and 698mg/kg (DFGOT (1996)). Since the calculated values was less than the lowest value, it was set as Category 3 based on 100mg/kg of the lowest value.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: The data of the guinea pigs were in PATTY (1994). But LD50 was not clear, it could not be classified due to the insufficient data.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Statistics calculation was done based on rat LC50 (4 hours): 4400ml/m3 and 6400 - 9100ml/m3 (all are DFGOT Vol.7 (1996)). Since the calculation value of 4400ml/m3 (4400ppm) was the same as the lowest value, it was considered as Category 4.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There was no skin irritation test data of this product (gas). But based on the description that 40% aqueous solution caused necrosis on skin of rabbits (PATTY, 4th 1994), it was judged to have skin corrosivenesses, and it was classified as Category 1A-1C. Since detailed data was unknown, sub-categorization was not available. [Display] It is more desirable to be classified as 1A from a viewpoint of safety, when it is necessary to sub-categorize.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is no data in eye irritation tests by this product (gas). But there is description that 40% solution has strong stimulativeness in the eye of a rabbit (ACGIH, 7th, 2001) and the lesional of a corneal (PATTY, 4th, 1994), it was set to Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: Although the allergenic or irritation data of bronchitis can be found on unpublished cases (ACGIH, 7th, 2001), since there is no case report in well known literature, it was decided that it could not be classified due to lack of sufficient.data. Skin sensitization: No data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause genetic defects (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: We classified it as Category 1B. Based on the description (RTECS (2005)) that there was a positive result in the dominant lethality examination by rat inhalation exposure examination.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is a statement that post-implantation fetal death increases depending on a dose in an inhalation exposure test of pregnant rats (DFGOT (1996)). However, it is indicated that evaluation is impossible, since details are not shown in the source material in the reference. On the other hand, although there is a report that reproductive toxicity tests in murine intraperitoneal administration did not show any effects (IUCLID (2000)), it will not negate the rat data of Priolity1. Therefore, since data was insufficient, it was considered unable to be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Although it is a Priolity 2 information, since there is a description that it has respiratory irritation against mucous membranes and may cause lung edemas at high exposure leves (HSFS (2004) and SITTIG (2002)), and it is classified as a substance which has an irritant action against the respiratory systems in the EU classification of dangerous sbstances as well. So it was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritant).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (respiratory organs, liver) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: The details are unknown, although the deviation enzyme in the blood including a nervous system, liver, and an immunology parameter and the morphological defect of organs, etc. in the nasal region exposure test for rats in DFGOT (1994) are reported. On the other hand, it was classified to Category 2 (respiratory systems, liver), since it is reported bronchitis and it has a potential to effect on liver by higher concentration exposures in HSFS (2004) and SITTIG (2002).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: it carried out the outside of Category from 48-hour EC50=163000microg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna), and others(AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=1.08*106mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
